div.p: Entries are taken on the Jbovlaste dictionary. Gismu etymologies are thanks to Mublin, who worked hard to compile them.

li.a: Jbovlaste, the de facto editable community dictionary

ul.li: Italy.
time tense: a long time before.
(tense/modal).
x2m1 is x1m2 minutes in duration by standard x3m3.
x1 is a nightingale of species/variety x2.
x1 is the difference between frame of reference x2 and frame of reference x3.

d:entry.p: magnetic variation is the difference between the magnetic reference frame and the rotational reference frame; see makfartci

ul.li: x1 is the duration of x2.

d:entry.p: See also ze'a, ze'e, ze'i, ze'o, ditcu, faurtei

ul.li: x1 is the answer/response/solution/[reply] to question/problem x2.

d:entry.p: (cf. ciksi, frati, preti, nabmi, spuda for agentive response/reply, cpedu)

ul.li: x1 is a standard of lateness for x2.
c1m2 (person) is intelligent/smart by standard c3.

d:entry.p: Cf. menli, certu, bebna, pensi, crexalbo

ul.li: x1 encourages x2 to do/be x3.
z1 sins by doing z2p1 by standard p2.
l1 is a mailing list with subscribers/recipients l2m3.
x1 (agent) inserts/interposes/puts/deposits x2 into interior x3/into among/between members of x3.

d:entry.p: Insertion need not imply a significant degree of 'filling'; inject (= je'erse'a); syringe/needle (= se'arterje'e, je'erse'atci, jestu'u or tu'urjesni); also pour, inflate, stuff, fill. See also rinci, tisna, punji, jbini, nenri, jmina, culno, kunti, catlu.

ul.li: attitudinal: love - no love lost - hatred.
m1 is very much/very extreme in property m2 (ka), towards m3 extreme/direction.

d:entry.p: Differs from mutce only in intensity; add more "tce" to taste. Made from mutce + mutce.

ul.li: x1 is a unicorn.

d:entry.p: Refers specifically to animals of the unicorn species, not the result of removing a horn from a two-horned animal.

ul.li: x1 promotes x2 to x3 (object, state).
g1 is a mask covering the face of g2f2.
x1 reflects Urdu language/culture/nationality in aspect x2.
v1 throws up v2 due to alcohol of type a2.
(adjective:) x1 is bent/crooked/not straight or direct/[twisted]/folded.

d:entry.p: See also cinje, klupe, kruvi, polje, sarlu, sirji, bargu, genxu.

ul.li: f1 is an event that has time/temporal duration t1 ranging from starting time/event t2 to ending time/event t3.
m1 is an axe for cutting k2 with blade m3k1 propelled by m4.
b1m3 grandly exhibits the corruptness b2m1 of unethical mass b3m2.
x1 expects x2 on grounds x3.
s1j1 misunderstands fact/truth j2 (du'u) about subject j3, an error under conditions s3 by standard s4.
x1 is born to x2 at time x3 [birthday] and place x4 [birthplace].
x1 is native to (fo) x4.

d:entry.p: x2 bears/gives birth to x1; also x3: natal day. See also fange, gutra, rorci, mamta, salci, citsi.

ul.li: x1 is an atom of element/atomic number x2 of isotope number/atomic weight x3.

d:entry.p: (cf. kantu for a basic unit of a property or activity; selci for a basic physical subunit, generally of a mass)

ul.li: c1 is tiny/miniature/diminutive/very small in property c2 with criterion c3.

d:entry.p: cmalu+cmalu; see also: cmacai, ruble, toltce; antonyms: brabra, tcebra

ul.li: x1 seems/appears to have property(ies) x2 to observer x3 under conditions x4.

d:entry.p: Also: x1 seems like it has x2 to x3; suggest belief/observation (= mlugau, mluti'i); looks like/resembles (= smimlu, mitmlu). See also catlu, viska, simsa, zgana, ganse, jarco.

ul.li: x1 is gray [color adjective].

d:entry.p: See also skari, blabi, xekri, kandi, carmi.

ul.li: terminator: end composite lerfu.
never elidable.
the mathematical expression (unevaluated).
convert unevaluated mathematical expression to sumti.
s1 is a gorilla of species/subspecies s2.
x1 prevents/keeps/stops/restrains/constrains event x2 from occurring.

d:entry.p: See also pinfu, bandu, zunti, rinju, jimte, bapli, rivbi.

ul.li: x1 is certain/sure/positive/convinced that x2 is true.

d:entry.p: See also jetnu, jinvi, krici, djuno, senpi, sruma.

ul.li: x3b1 arches/curves over/around x2b2 and is made of x1b3.
x3b1 is an arch over/around x2b2 of material x1b3.
x1 (event) defends/protects x2 (object/state) from threat/peril/potential x3 (event).

d:entry.p: Also secures (verb); x1 wards/resists x3; protective cover/shield (= badgai). See also ckape, fanta, fapro, marbi, rivbi, zunti, snura, binra, lunbe, pulji.

ul.li: links terms into an afterthought termset.
x1 is an aromatic chemical of type x2.
x1 is small in property/dimension(s) x2 (ka) as compared with standard/norm x3.

d:entry.p: See also caxno, cinla, jarki, tordu, barda.

ul.li: x1 is/appears to be of color/hue x2 as perceived/seen by x3 under conditions x4.

d:entry.p: Conditions may include lighting, background, etc.. See also blanu, bunre, cicna, cinta, crino, grusi, narju, nukni, pelxu, xunre, zirpu, carmi, kandi, xekri, blabi.

ul.li: x1 is friction [force opposing motion] due to contact/rubbing between x2 and x3.
(fe) x2 rubs x3.

d:entry.p: Also x2 scrubs/wipes/brushes (against) x3 (= seltermosra); non-agentive rub (= termosra). See also sakli, sraku, jabre, satre, guska, pencu, spali.

ul.li: x1 is December of year x2 in calendar x3.
x1 is the cross product of x2 and x3.
attitudinal: fear - security.
r1 is (a) heterosexual.
x1 is a/the abdomen/belly/lower trunk [body-part] of x2.
[metaphor: midsection].

d:entry.p: Also stomach (= djaruntyrango), digestive tract (= befctirango, befctirangyci'e). See also cutne, livga, canti.

ul.li: m1b1 is chewing gum of type/composition m2 in shape/form m3.
l1 drags/hauls l2m2 by handle/at locus l3 along surface m3.
cusku modal, 1st place (attribution/quotation) as said by source ...
used for quotation.
b1 is a rainbow at location b2t2.
x3b1 exceeds/is beyond limit/boundary x2b2 from x1b3 in property/amount x4b4 (ka/ni).
x1t2 is the purpose of tool/utensil/resource/instrument/implement x2t1.
x1 is an annoyed with pest x2.
cinmo modal, 2nd place (shows attitude) emotionally.
emoting ...
x1 expects/anticipates x2 to happen.
m1 is a hagfish of species m2.
quantified selbri: convert 8 to ordinal selbri.
x1 is eighth among x2 ordered by rule x3.
x2c1 is a window/portal/opening in wall/building/structure x1c2.

d:entry.p: se canko, see also bitmu, dinju, kevna, greku, kumfa, korbi

ul.li: c1t1f5 is the legislative branch of the government of people/territory/domain/subjects t2.

d:entry.p: from flalu turni ciste c.f. truci'e zuktruci'e pairtruci'e flacfatrugri flazautrugri

ul.li: x1 is military/regimented/is strongly organized/prepared by system x2 for purpose x3.

d:entry.p: Also paramilitary; soldier in its broadest sense - not limited to those trained/organized as part of an army to defend a state (= bilpre). See also jenmi for a military force, sonci, ganzu, pulji.

ul.li: logical connective: bridi-tail afterthought and.
x1 is a parasite of x2.
2-word letteral/shift: punctuation mark or special symbol follows.
x1 (du'u) contradicts/denies/refutes/negates x2 (du'u) under rules/logic x3.

d:entry.p: Also exception (= nafmupli); agentive contradict/deny (= nafxu'a or tolxu'a). See also nibli, tugni, zanru, xusra.

ul.li: x1 utters moan/groan/howl/scream [non-linguistic utterance] x2 expressing x3 (property).

d:entry.p: Also shriek, most animal sounds, e.g. bark, cackle, meow, neigh, moo, honk, baa, crow. See also krixa, bacru, cusku, cortu.

ul.li: x3 illuminates/lights x2 with light/illumination x1.
x2 is lit/illuminated by illumination x1 from source x3 (= selgu'i for reordered places).
light/lamp (= tergu'i) See also dirce, manku, solri, carmi, ctino, kantu.

d:entry.p: x3 illuminates/lights x2 with light/illumination x1; x2 is lit/illuminated by illumination x1 from source x3 (= selgu'i for reordered places); light/lamp (= tergu'i) See also dirce, manku, solri, carmi, ctino, kantu, gusku'a.

ul.li: x1 is regarded seriously by (person) x2.
quantified selbri: convert .2 = 1/5 to portion selbri.
x1 is 1/5 of mass/totality x2.
Laotze (aka. Laozi).
g1 develops f1 into f2 from f3 through stages f4.
c1 is homeless.
x1 is an evergreen tree of species/variety x2.
x1 is a bottle/jar/urn/flask/closable container for x2, made of material x3 with lid x4.

d:entry.p: See also baktu, lante, patxu, tansi, tanxe, vasru, gacri.

ul.li: t1 is a bus terminal/station/depot in transport system t2 for buses for carrying p1k2 .
x1 is a/the argument of predicate/function x2 filling place x3 (kind/number).

d:entry.p: (x1 and x2 are text); See also bridi, darlu, gismu.

ul.li: catni modal, 1st place by authority of ...
m1 is nature/the world of living things m2j1, defined by rules m3.
x1 is a berry (fruit/plant) of plant/species x2.

d:entry.p: See also grute, tsiju, narge, grute.

ul.li: x1 causes x2 to wait for x3 at x4 before continuing x5.
x1 (person) is lazy/avoiding work/effort concerning action x2.
x1 (du'u) is true/truth by standard/epistemology/metaphysics x2.

d:entry.p: Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place. See also stace, jitfa, fatci, birti, cfika.

ul.li: quantified selbri: convert 1 to cardinal selbri.
x1 is a set with single/sole/only member x2.
x1 is a cell/atom/unit/molecule of x2.
x1 is an indivisible, most basic subunit of x2.

d:entry.p: (x2 generally has mass nature); (cf. kantu for properties, activities; ratni, gradu)

ul.li: tadji modal, 3rd place methodically doing (something) under conditions ...
convert sumti to mex operand.
sample use in story arithmetic: [3 apples] + [3 apples] = what.
x1 is a vehicle/mode of transport carrying x2 in/on surface/medium x3, propelled by x4.

d:entry.p: See also klama, matra, bevri, bloti, carce, karce, sabnu, skiji.

ul.li: x1 is a shortage/deficiency/insufficiency/derth/too little of x2 by standard x3.
x1k3 is the relationship between x2k1, x3k2, x3...
x1 is a property of x2.

d:entry.p: From su'o te ckini. Any number of places may be used. This word was invented by xorxes and is intended as an alternative to quantified selbri with bu'a; it allows the relations to be specified as sumti.

ul.li: x1 [person/agent] is an agentive cause of event x2.
x1 does/brings about x2.

d:entry.p: (cf. cmavo list gau, gunka, zukte, rinka, fasnu for non-agentive events, jibri, kakne, pilno)

ul.li: x1 is the size of x2 in property/dimension x3 on scale x4.
m1 is 1048576 (220) of m2 in dimension/aspect m3 (default is units).
b1 is huge/enormous/very big in property b2 with criterion b3.

d:entry.p: barda+barda; see also: caibra, tcebra, selte'abra, dukse, cimni, camganra; antonym: cmacma

ul.li: x1 [person/passive/state] undergoes/experiences x2 (event/experience).
x2 happens to x1.

d:entry.p: Also has/have (of events/experiences); (adjective:) x1 is empirical; suggests passive undergoing but does not exclude active (per zukte) intent; a deserved experience: reward or punishment (= jernyfri, zanjernyfri, maljernyfri). See also cmavo list ri'i, jmive, fasnu, renvi.

ul.li: x1 is a leek of variety x2.
logical connective: forethought all but tanru-internal connective question (with gi).
attitudinal: pity - cruelty.
they.

d:entry.p: repeats two or more preceding sumti, not one plural sumti

ul.li: x1 is a voice/speech sound of individual x2.
logical connective: tanru-internal forethought exclusive or (with gi).
Latin 'aut'.
x1 is a cover/[lid/top] for covering/concealing/sheltering x2.

d:entry.p: See also pilka, gapru, marbi, drudi, ve botpi, bitmu, calku.

ul.li: t1 is a seaport/ferry terminal in transport system t2 for boats/ships/vessels of type b2 propelled by b3.
l1v1 is a child who is a native speaker of Lojban.

d:index.d:value: anarchy (a theory that regards the absence of all direct or coercive government as a political ideal)

ul.li: c1 is an anarchy/is anarchic.
x1m1 is December of year x2m2 in calendar x3m3.
t1 is a deciduous tree of species t2.
x1 is a slice [thin flat portion] of x2 (mass).
x1 is a pot/kettle/urn/tub/sink, a deep container for contents x2, of material/properties x3.

d:entry.p: (cf. tansi, palne for depth; baktu, botpi for open/lidded)

ul.li: l1 is ergot of species l2.

d:entry.p: A fungus that grows on rye and other cereals; it contains the alkaloid ergotamine, which has hallucinogenic effects on humans and animals, and from which LSD!en is synthesized.

ul.li: x1 falls/drops to x2 from x3 in gravity well/frame of reference x4.

d:entry.p: Note: things can fall in spin, thrust, or tide as well as gravity; (agentive "drop" = one of two lujvo: falcru and falri'a). See also lafti, cpare, klama, sfubu.

ul.li: x1 (agent) invests resources x2 in investment x3 expecting return/profit x4 (object(s)/event).

d:entry.p: [also ties up/Risks/gambles. x1 is an investor; x2 are invested assets of x1; bond (= jertervle)]; See also prali, canja, jbera, dejni, ponse.

ul.li: 2nd assignable variable predicate (context determines place structure).
digit/number: at most (all).
no more than.
x1p1 is a network route/path to node x2p2t1 from node x3p3t1 via points/nodes x4p4 within transport/communication/distribution system/network x5t2.

d:entry.p: Unusual in that t1 appears more than once. x4 is also really a set of t1s. See also tcana, pluta

ul.li: ckini modal, 1st place (related to) relatively.
as a relation of ...
x1 is a blade of tool/weapon x2.

d:entry.p: See also dakfu, tunta, tutci, guska, kinli, katna.

ul.li: p1 is a computer process with inputs p2 and outputs/results p3, passing through stages p4, on computer s1.

d:entry.p: Taken from NORALUJV.TXT. lujvo from skami and pruce.

ul.li: elidable terminator: end discursive bridi or mathematical precedence.
usually elidable.
x1z1 is at an edge/margin/border/curb/boundary of x2k2 next-to/bordering-on x3k3.
x1z1 skirts x2k2.
x1 is a/the pubic area/external genitalia [body-part] of x2.

d:entry.p: See also cinse, gletu, pinji, vibna, vlagi, ganti, mabla.

ul.li: x1 is a pen using ink x2 applied by process x3.

d:entry.p: See also ciska, pinsi, xinmo, pimlu.

ul.li: x1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of coal/peat/anthracite/bituminous from source x2.
x1 is a catfish of genus/species x2.
x1m1 is May of year x2m2 in calendar x3m3.
x1 feels wonder/awe/marvels about x2.

d:entry.p: See also cinmo, makfa, kucli, spaji, cinri, banli, sisku.

ul.li: x1 is a fish of species x2 [metaphorical extension to sharks, non-fish aquatic vertebrates].
x1 isn't the-same-thing-as/is different-from/other-than x2 by standard x3.
x1 is something else.
z1t1 is Asia.

d:entry.p: from xazdo tumla c.f. rontu'a bemtu'a tcotu'a sralytu'a frikytu'a ziptu'a

ul.li: s1 (place) hides m2s2 from m3 by method m4.
s1 is a hiding place.
logical connective: sentence afterthought or.
x2b1 runs on surface x1b2 using limbs x3b3 with gait x4b4.
x1 is slow/sluggish at doing/being/bringing about x2 (event/state).
x1 is a candirú of species/variety x2.

d:entry.p: syn. finprvandeli, pincyfi'e; see also latfi'e

ul.li: x1 is in the future of/later than/after x2 in time sequence.
x1 is latter.
x2 is former.

d:entry.p: Also sequel, succeed, successor, follow, come(s) after; time ordering only (use lidne otherwise); aorist in that x1 may overlap in time with x2 as long as it extends afterwards; non-aorist future (= cfabalvi); (default x2 is the space time reference, whereupon:) x1 will occur. See also lidne, cabna, purci, farna.

ul.li: x1 (action) is clumsy/awkward by standard x2.
x1 is automatic in function x2 under conditions x3.
v1 is a coffin containing v2m1.
x1 thirsts for x2.
x1 needs/wants drink/fluid/lubrication x2.

d:entry.p: See also nitcu, djica, xagji, pinxe.

ul.li: n1 is an instruction for n2m3 (event/state) to occur, issued by n3m1 for intended recipient n4m2.
x1 is a quantity of protein/albumin of type x2 composed of amino acids (sequence/jo'u).
description pro-sumti: reuses the value of the x4 of the previous bridi.
x1 invents/creates/composes/authors x2 for function/purpose x3 from existing elements/ideas x4.

d:entry.p: x1 is creative/inventive. See also cmavo list fi'e, ciska, pemci, zbasu, larcu, specific works of authorship, prosa, skina.

ul.li: x1 is maple of species/variety x2.
n1 is an international group of peoples n2.
x1 is an elephant of species/breed x2.
x1 is a sunflower of species/variety x2.
k1x2 pretends x1[concept].
x1 is tired/fatigued by effort/situation x2 (event).
x1 needs/wants rest.
x1 is fast/swift/quick/hastes/rapid at doing/being/bringing about x2 (event/state).
x1 pertains to the internet/cyberspace in aspect x2.
x1 reflects/mirrors/echoes x2 [object/radiation] to observer/point x3 as x4.
x2 bounces on x1.

d:entry.p: Also: x1 is a mirror/reflector. x2 may be light, lu'e of an imaged object; x4 may be image or echo or the same as x2 if physical object; x3 may be a path for a bounced object; ka is reflection. See also catlu, viska, lenjo, pensi.

ul.li: x1 [ideal] is the conceptual shape/form of object/abstraction/manifestation x2 (object/abstract).

d:entry.p: Also pattern; x1 is the mathematical or theoretical ideal form, while x2 is an object/event manifesting that form; e.g. circular/circle-shaped (= cukseltai) vs. circle (=cuktai, while cukla alone is ambiguous); model (= ci'ersaptai, saptai, ci'ersmitai, smitai). See alse nejni, te marji for physical shape, tapla, bliku, kubli, kurfa, cukla, mapti, morna, sarlu.

ul.li: sumti qualifier: the sequence made from set or composed of elements/components.
order is vague.
x1 is a camera/photographic equipment recording illumination type x2 images to medium x3.
discursive: exaggeration - accuracy - understatement.
x1 arches/curves over/around x2 and is made of x3.
x1 is an arch over/around x2 of material x3.

d:entry.p: Also arc; x2 need not be an object, but may be a point or volume. See also cripu, kruvi, korcu, condi.

ul.li: x1 desires/wants/wishes x2 (event/state) for purpose x3.

d:entry.p: If desire is for an object, this is sumti-raising; use tu'a in x2 (or use lujvo = po'edji). See also taske, xagji, mukti, nitcu, nelci, pacna, prami, rigni, trina, xebni, xlura.

ul.li: logical connective: sumti afterthought or.
x1 is a mango of species/variety x2.
x1 is able to use x2 for purpose x3 under conditions x4.
attitudinal modifier: aggressive - passive - defensive.
jalge modal, 1st place (event causal) nevertheless result ...
x1 is a 4-dimensional spacetime/region occupied by x2 .
logically quantified existential pro-sumti: there exists something 2 (usually restricted).
sumti assignment.
used to define/assign ko'a/fo'a series pro-sumti.
Latin 'sive'.
x1s1m1 is the material environment/surrounding material (i.e. gaseous/liquid atmosphere, vacuum, etc.) enclosing x2s2 in direction(s)/dimensions(s)/plane x3s3m3, of type/composition including x4m2.

d:entry.p: A vacuum is arguably not 'material', but the word is much more convenient if that is included. Also, vacuum is never completely empty. See also marji, sruri, gapci, litki, kunti, sakci, kensa.

ul.li: attitudinal: certainty question.
b1g1 is Bangladesh.
x1 is a parcel/expanse of land at location x2.
x1 is terrain.

d:entry.p: (cf. vacri, xamsi; tutra, which need not be land, gugde, xamsi)

ul.li: x1 is uninteresting to x2.
vocative: request to send/speak.
discursive: by the way - returning to main point.
x1 is a glacier of land mass x2, draining snowshed x3 into x4.
p1 is military police officer enforcing law(s)/rule/order p2.
x1 is regular/cyclical/periodic in property (ka)/activity x2 with period/interval x3.

d:entry.p: Also uniform; resonant (= dikslicai). See also slilu, rilti, xutla, manfo, boxna.

ul.li: n1 is the marriage of s1 and s2 according to tradition s3.
x1 exceeds/is beyond limit/boundary x2 from x3 in property/amount x4 (ka/ni).

d:entry.p: On the other side of a bound, but not necessarily directly 'across' nor at the shortest plausible distance (per ragve); also not limited to position in space. See also dukse, ragve, zmadu, kuspe.

ul.li: location tense relation/direction.
coincident with/at the same place as.
space equivalent of ca.
x1 is a walnut of species x2.
x1 is a quantity of/made from/consists of wool [tight curly hair] from animal/species/source x2.

d:entry.p: See also kosta, kumte, lanme, kanba, bukpu, kerfa.

ul.li: x2r1 engenders/procreates/begets x1r2 with coparent x3r3.
x1 is x2 kilometres long in direction x3 by standard x4.
x1 possesses/owns/has x2 under law/custom x3.
x1 is owner/proprietor of x2 under x3.

d:entry.p: (x3 is generally more important to the concept than commonly accepted for the English equivalent, since the concept is broader when unconstrained, and the nature/interpretation of possession/ownership is very culturally dependent); See also ckini, ralte, jitro, steci, srana, tutra, turni, zivle.

ul.li: pilno modal, 1st place used by ...
quantified selbri: convert 3 to ordinal selbri.
x1 is third among x2 ordered by rule x3.
space motion tense: northwardly.
to the north directional space motion.
x2b1 grows/expands [an increasing development] to size/into form x1b2 from x3b3.
Georgia (Caucasus).
x1 is a passport issued to x2 (person) by authority x3 allowing x4 (activity).
x1d1 is a period of x2d2 non-working days/vacation days/holidays for worker x3g1 at job x4g2.
quantified selbri: converts enough to ordinal.
x1 is enoughth among x2, order rule x3.
convert mathematical expression (mex) operator to a selbri/tanru component.
finti modal, 1st place (creator) created by ...
x1 reflects Hispano-American culture/nationalities in aspect x2.

d:entry.p: Refers to Spanish-speaking Latin-American countries, not Brazil/Guyana. See also merko, mexno, spano, ketco, bemro, gento.

ul.li: x1 is the time-duration/interval/period/[elapsed time] of event x2.

d:entry.p: cedra, ranji, tcika, renvi, temci, canlu, kuspe, krafamtei

ul.li: s1 is verbatim/to the letter.

d:entry.p: Used of text. Cf. valsi, satci, sitna, jufra

ul.li: discursive: newly introduced information - previously introduced information.
half.
g1c1 rides/mounts/has sexual intercourse on top of g2c2, in frame of reference/gravity c3.
zmadu modal, 1st place (a greater) exceeded by ... .
usually a sumti modifier.
p1 hopes for p2 (event).
p1 hopes that p2 happens.

d:entry.p: p2 is possible and has medium probability. Cf. pacna, sotpa'a, sojypa'a

ul.li: x1 is a poppy of species x2.
x1 is ginger of species x2.
x2b1 is a wave/periodic pattern in medium x1b2, with wave-form x3b3, wave-length x4b4 and frequency x5b5.
x1 walks/strides/paces on surface x2 using limbs x3.

d:entry.p: See also stapa, bajra, klama, litru.

ul.li: start quote of replacement for recent mistakenly uttered text.
n1 is a real number.

d:entry.p: Also: x1 signifies x2; (adjective:) x1 is significant/meaningful/of import; signal an action (= sniti'i), connotation (= se sibyti'isni, sibyti'ismu). See also lerfu, tcita, barna, mifra, smuni.

d:entry.p: se la'ornai means the Roman people. The term refers to the ancient Romans, not to modern-day residents of the Italian capital, or small Wisconsin town.

with property ...

ul.li: vocative: ready to receive - not ready to receive.

indicated thing far from speaker&listener.
x1 is an article/descriptor labelling description x2 (text) in language x3 with semantics x4.

d:entry.p: x2 is the noun phrase/sumti without the article/descriptor; description ((x1 with x2) = gadysu'i); note: 'determiner' has become the accepted general linguistics term, displacing 'article'; however, 'determiner' includes all words that can introduce a noun phrase/sumti, whether a description or not, such as pronoun possessives like lemi, quantifiers (especially in indefinites) like ci and su'o, and demonstratives like ti, ta, and tu; the term 'descriptor' in Lojban, is limited to words that introduce descriptions (excluding indefinites), such as those of selma'o LA and LE, their common compounds such as lemi, and possibly lenu. 'article' typically refers only to a single word; Lojban assumes the broader meaning] See also valsi, cmavo.

ul.li: evidential: I observe.
x1 is galangal of variety x2.
attitudinal: weak intensity attitude modifier.
x1 copulates/fucks/mates/has coitus/sexual intercourse with x2.

d:entry.p: x1 and x2 are symmetrical; mounts (= cpanygle). See also cinse, pinji, plibu, vibna, vlagi, mabla, speni.

repeats claim as true, updating for speaker/listener change.

d:entry.p: (x3 is complete specification of set); (cf. cizra, fadni, cafne, kampu, cnano - the generalized opposite to any/all of these concepts)

d:entry.p: Also acting at, undertaking, doing; agentive cause with volition/purpose; also x3 objective, end. See also cmavo list zu'e, bapli, gunka, jalge, krinu, mukti, rinka, snuti, gasnu, fasnu, minji, prenu, ciksi, jibri, pilno, pluta, tadji, tutci.

d:entry.p: (adjective:) x1 is curved; (x4 as a set of points is sufficiently specified to identify the relevant properties of the bend). See also korcu, bargu, genxu, linji, sirji.

d:entry.p: Also world; a universe is a kind of system, one which comprehensively encompasses its domain; e.g. 'universe of discourse', or 'world of birds'; x3 are the rules/defining principles which distinguish the universe from other universes, or from non-universe. See also ciste, plini, kensa, mulno.

d:entry.p: Also: x2 is worth x1 to x3; (for x2 person:) x2 merits (one sense), (adjective:) x2 is worthy (= selva'i for reordered places); merit reward (= nemselva'i); receive merited reward (= vamselne'u); x2 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= posyva'i, posyselva'i for unambiguous semantics). (cf. jdima, jerna, vecnu, dirba, janta, kargu, pleji; see note at jdima on cost/price/value distinction, vajni)

x1 (agent) rewards x2 [recipient] for atypical x3 (event/property) with reward/desserts x4.

d:entry.p: Differs from earned payment because of atypical nature; rewards need not be positive but are in some sense deserved from the point of view of the rewarder: positive reward (= zanyne'u), punishment, penalty, demerit (= malne'u, sfane'u); x4 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= posne'u, posyvelne'u for unambiguous semantics). See also dunda, friti, jerna, jinga, jivna, pleji, sfasa, venfu, prali, dapma.

ul.li: x1 [amount] is the price of x2 to purchaser/consumer x3 set by vendor x4.

d:entry.p: x2 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= posydi'a, posyseldi'a for unambiguous semantics); price is something decided/set by the seller, and is closely akin to offer (friti), which is what a buyer may decide; (note that price is not he same as cost/expense, which is the actual amount exchanged in a transaction; the latter is vecnu or canja; neither is the same as "value" or vamji; in colloquial English, these are sometimes interchanged, at least partially because of the rarity of barter and bargaining in the marketplace). See also canja, friti, janta, jdini, kargu, pleji, dapma, vamji for 'value', ve vecnu for 'cost', canja, fepni, jerna, jinga, pleji, prali, rupnu, sfasa, vamji.

ul.li: x1 hopes/wishes for/desires x2 (event), expected likelihood x3 (0-1).

d:entry.p: Also: x1 is hopeful of x2; x2 will hopefully occur, as hoped for by x1; the value of x3 is a subjective estimate of likeliness according to x1, and is the basic determinant of whether pacna means 'hope' or 'wish' or 'expect': hoping for objects/states with negligible expectation is "wishing"; if the state is plausibly likely, it is "hoping"; when the probability is subjectively near 1, the attitude is described as "expecting"; the value will usually be expressed using inexact numbers ("li piso'u" to "li piro"); wish (= sotpa'a), hope (= sorpa'a), expect (= sojypa'a). See also djica.

Example: 'ko'a zvati lo julra'o be li reno pi'e pavo pi'e cino bei be'a [lo plinyxabykoi] be'o .e lo julra'o be li pano pi'e pare pi'e vomu bei du'a [lo vajrai jedjipli'i]' means 'it is located at 20° 14' 30" N [of the Equator] and 10° 12' 45" E [of the Prime Meridian].

d:entry.p: Behold/watch/gaze (= vi'azga); guard/watchman/sentinel (= zgaku'i, jdeku'i). See also cmavo list ga'a, ganse, viska, catlu, tirna, pencu, sumne, kurji, canci, catlu, jarco, lanli, pinka, simlu.

d:entry.p: [reveal (= tolmipygau, mipyja'o, sivja'o); also: x1 shows that x2, x1 shows off x2; showing an object is generally expressed with a tu'a x2, since the properties of the shown object (other than its presence) intended for observation are seldom specified (simple presence could be expressed by leka Object. cu zvati)]; See also tigni, cipra, zgana, jvinu, lanli, mipri, simlu.

d:entry.p: Cf. gugde, pagbu, selci. A province can also be a first-level administrative division; for this use gugypau, or optionally vipygu'e if it is in a country with a federal government.

d:entry.p: x3 need not be a container, but could merely be a site/location restriction; e.g. a heap. The sumti indicates how the supply is identified and distinguished from other occurrences of the stored x2 that are not part of the store. (cf. panka; vreji for information storage; sabji for a store or reserve that is not necessarily tied to a site, banxa, panka)

d:entry.p: Also x4 commodities; x4 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= posle'i, posyvelyle'i for unambiguous semantics); rent (= jerle'i, lejyjbera). (cf. canja, cnemu, friti, kargu, vecnu, jdima, prali, jerna, sfasa, dunda, jinga, dapma; see note at jdima on cost/price/value distinction, cirko, dirba)

See also barda, nobli, se sinma, pluja, misno, vajni, fasnu, cizra, traji, mutce, se manci.

Yahweh.

d:entry.p: Also: x1 is parallel to x2, x3 is the only difference between x1 and x2 (= terpanra for reordered places); x1 and x2 are alike/similar/congruent. A parallel involves extreme close similarity/correspondence across the entirety of the things being compared, generally involving multiple properties, with focus placed on one or a small number of differences. See also pa'a, mintu, simsa, girzu, vrici.

ul.li: x1 governs/rules/is ruler/governor/sovereign/reigns over people/territory/domain/subjects x2.

d:entry.p: x2 need not be complete specification of set of governed; reign/rule (= noltru); king/queen/sovereign (= nolraitru); pure democracy (= roltrusi'o), representative democracy (= rolka'itrusi'o), viceroy (= ka'itru), pure communism (= guntrusi'o), board of directors/trustees, steering committee (= trukamni); government (= trugunma, trugri (emphasizing the components), truci'e (emphasizing the organization)). See also catni, minde, tutra, jecta, gugde, ponse, jitro.

ul.li: x1 breaks/fractures/shatters/[splits/splinters/cracks] into pieces x2.

d:entry.p: See also xrani, spofu, se katna.

ul.li: x1 is between/among set of points/bounds/limits x2 (set)/amidst mass x2 in property x3 (ka).

d:entry.p: x2 (a complete set, generally ordered) defines the bounds/limits/range for x1. See also se vasru, nenri, zvati, cpana, snuji, senta, bitmu, jimte, kuspe, jibni, lamji, sruri, vanbi, midju, cmima, setca.

ul.li: x1 is a basis/foundation/underlying or fundamental principle of x2.
x1 is at the bottom of x2.

d:entry.p: x2 is founded on basis x1 (= selcmu for reordered places); (adjective:) x1 is basic/basal/fundamental); (generally events and properties will be bases for events and states, while objects may be bases/bottoms for objects). See also cmavo list ji'u, jamfu, zbepi, genja, krasi.

d:entry.p: Refers to any kind of reliance upon English in a Lojban expression, but is most common for calques. Is sometimes even extended to cover reliance upon cultural assumptions. ``malglico'' is a much more common form.

d:entry.p: Pedantically, inheriting an object should be a sumti-raising (tu'a if non-abstract in x2) of inheriting loka ponse the object - the ownership of the object (= posycerda, posyselcerda for unambiguous semantics). See also jgina.

ul.li: discursive: exaggeration - accuracy - understatement.
x1 expects/looks for the occurence of x2 (event), expected likelihood x3 (0-1, default li so'a (i.e. near 1)).
x1 subjectively evaluates the likelihood of x2 (event) to be x3.

d:entry.p: Notes: The value of x3 is a subjective estimate of likeliness according to x1, and is the basic determinant of whether kanpe means something like "hope" or "wish" or "expect", although kanpe never carries the connotation of desire; for that connotation see pacna. kanpe with x3 not very close to 1 has no simple equivalent in English, but for objects/states with negligible expectation it is something like "wishing"; if the state is plausibly likely, it is something like "hoping". In both cases, though, the English implication of emotional desire is not present. The value will usually be expressed using inexact numbers ("li piso'u" to "li piro"); non-desirous wish (= ??), non-desirous hope (= ??); (cf. djica, pacna)

ul.li: x1 (event/state/property) is probable/likely under conditions x2.

ul.li: l1 is a regular/predictable lujvo (compound predicate word) with meaning l2 and arguments l3 built from phrase l4 and having an argument structure according to rule j1.

d:entry.p: A Lojban-specific term. The approach of \emphjvajvo is intended to at least constrain what the x2, x3, x4... etc. of a lujvo may be, and also to draw the semantic values of those places from the semantic values of the places of the component brivla. The rationale is that the place structure of an unknown lujvo should not require memorization. This was previously known as ``dikyjvo''; a mistranslation of ``regular lujvo'', as it used the wrong sense of ``regular'' (see dikni).

d:entry.p: As the whole point of this word is to ignore the agentive nature of c1, c1 has been dropped. Made from curmi + tcini.

ul.li: x1 [sequence] is in reverse order from x2 [sequence].

d:entry.p: Also opposite (one sense). See also cmavo list fa'e, dukti.

ul.li: attitudinal modifier/honorific: hauteur - equal rank - meekness.
used with one of equal rank.
x1 is a flower bud of plant/species x2.
x1 knows fact(s) x2 (du'u) about subject x3 by epistemology x4.

d:entry.p: Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place; know how to - implying knowledge of method but not necessarily having the ability to practice (= tadjyju'o). (cf. know/familiar with: se slabu, na'e cnino, na'e fange; cmavo list du'o, cilre, certu, facki, jijnu, jimpe, senpi, smadi, kakne, birti, mipri, morji, saske, viska)

ul.li: x1 [hours, minutes, seconds] is the time/hour of state/event x2 on day x3 at location x4.

d:entry.p: Also o'clock, time-of-day. (time units in x1 are specified as numbers separated by pi'e or are unit values massified with joi); See also cmavo list ti'u, cacra, cerni, detri, donri, djedi, junla, nicte, mentu, snidu, temci, vanci, dirba, mokca.

ul.li: s3t1 is Christmas, the celebration of the birth of the founder of the Christian religion.
b1 archives s1b2 in medium b5.

d:entry.p: snura benji; see also vreji, fukpi, citri, jmaji, sorcu, morji

ul.li: s1p1 is a line in the text s2.
m1 is a vibrator/vibrating device for use/function m2.

d:entry.p: not necessarily sex toy; Cf. desku, minji, runpinji. See xremi'i for shaking machines with the purpose of mixing.

ul.li: m1p1 is me.

d:entry.p: Used instead of mi when a brivla is needed.

ul.li: x1 is molasses from source x2 of composition x3.
o1i1 is Jbovlaste.

d:entry.p: A web-based Lojban dictionary editing system, and the contents of its dictionary. Cf. lojbo, valsi, liste, vlaste, vlacku

ul.li: following digits code a character (in ASCII, Unicode, etc.).
5th assignable variable predicate (context determines place structure).
abstractor: generalized abstractor (how).
x1 is [bridi] as a non-specific abstraction of type x2.
x1 hears x2 against background/noise x3.
x2 is audible.
(adjective:) x1 is aural.

d:entry.p: See also kerlo, sance, smaji, savru, voksa, ganse, zgana.

ul.li: x1 is distributed/allotted/allocated/shared among x2 with shares/portions x3.
(x2/x3 fa'u).

d:entry.p: Also spread, shared out, apportioned; agentive distribution (= fairgau, fairzu'e). See also cmavo list fa'u, fendi, preja, katna, tcana.

ul.li: l1 is earwax/cerumen.
x1 is a billion [British milliard] [109] of x2 in dimension/aspect x3 (default is units).

d:entry.p: (cf. grake, mitre, snidu, stero, delno, molro, kelvo, xampo, gradu. litce, merli, centi, decti, dekto, femti, gocti, gotro, kilto, megdo, mikri, milti, nanvi, petso, picti, terto, xatsi, xecto, xexso, zepti, zetro)

ul.li: x1 loses person/thing x2 at/near x3.
x1 loses property/feature x2 in conditions/situation x3.

d:entry.p: x2 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event (rare for cirko), or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= po'ecri, posyselcri for unambiguous semantics). See also facki, ralte, sisku, claxu, jinga, pleji, canja, sfasa, dapma, binra, mipri.

ul.li: x1 is cyan/turquoise/greenish-blue [color adjective].

d:entry.p: See also skari, blabi, xekri, kandi, carmi, crino, blanu.

ul.li: s1 is sociolinguistics based on methodology s2.

x1 is a/the flower/blossom/bloom [body-part] of plant/species x2.
(adjective:) x1 is floral.
x2b1 (object) suffices/is enough/sufficient for purpose x1b2 under conditions x3b3.
x1 is immaterial/not physical/without material form.

d:entry.p: See also marji, menli, pruxi, sidbo.

ul.li: x1 is dirty laundry worn by x2 for purpose x3, dirty with x4.
f1 is worth f2m1 US cents.
x1 is the absolute value/norm of x2.
x1 is an x2 by x3 vector array/matrix of vectors x4, x5, x6...
x1 is buckwheat of variety x2.
x1 is English/pertains to English-speaking culture in aspect x2.

d:entry.p: Generally assume broadest sense of 'English'; may refer to 'English', pertaining to the country/people/culture of England (normally requiring constraint = gligu'e, or simply redundancy = gligli-); British English, the norm language of the UK (= gliglibau). (cf. brito which refers to the United Kingdom as a whole or to the British empire, merko, sralo, kadno, skoto)

ul.li: x1 is a line/among lines [1-dimensional shape/form] defined by set of points x2.

d:entry.p: Ray/vector (farli'i or porli'i). See also kruvi, sirji, jganu, kantu, mokca.

ul.li: x1 hates/despises x2 (object/abstraction).
x1 is full of hate for x2.
x2 is odious to x1.

d:entry.p: x1 is hateful (one sense); x2 is hateful (different sense). See also djica, nitcu, rigni, prami, nelci.

ul.li: r1b1 is the Arabic language used by b2 to express/communicate b3 (si'o/du'u, not quote).
x1 (site/event) is a source/start/beginning/origin of x2 (object/event/process).

d:entry.p: Also root (figurative sense); (adjective:) x1 is initial. See also fanmo, cmavo list ra'i, sabji, cfari, jipno, traji, kojna, genja, jicmu, sitna, jinto.

ul.li: p1n1 is a beginner/novice/newcomer/greenhorn to observer n2 in feature n3 (ka) by standard n4.
x1 [agent] shoves/pushes x2 at locus x3.

d:entry.p: Move by pushing/shoving (= ca'ermuvgau). (cf. danre for non-agentive force, lacpu)

being pleasing under conditions ...

d:entry.p: general term for spiny mammals; see also ernace, zalgosu, jesyratcu

ul.li: x1 is big/large in property/dimension(s) x2 (ka) as compared with standard/norm x3.

d:entry.p: See also banli, clani, ganra, condi, plana, cmalu, rotsu, banro, xanto.

d:index.d:value: to blame, to lay blame on

x1 is a boy/lad [young male person] of age x2 immature by standard x3.

d:entry.p: Word dispreferred in metaphor/example as sexist; (use verba). See also nixli, verba, nanmu, bersa.

n-ary mathematical operator: operands are vectors to be treated as matrix columns.

d:entry.p: See also danlu, ladru, tatru, ractu, xanto, xarju.

ul.li: location tense interval: a tiny region of space.
x1 (tool/blade/force) cuts [through]/splits/divides x2 (object) into pieces x3.

d:entry.p: For x1 force, it is a force acting as a blade, not acting upon a blade; agentive cutting (= ka'argau, ka'arzu'e). (cf. kakpa, sraku for cutting into without division; plixa, dakfu, jinci, porpi, spofu, tunta, xrani, fatri, fendi, balre, dilcu)

ul.li: x1 steps/treads on/in surface x2 using limbs x3.

d:entry.p: See also bajra, plipe, cadzu, serti.

x1 melts object x2.
discursive: generously - parsimoniously.

d:entry.p: See also turni, tutra, krati, cmavo list ca'i, jaspu, pulji.

102] of x2 in dimension/aspect x3 (default is units).

d:entry.p: (cf. grake, mitre, snidu, stero, delno, molro, kelvo, xampo, gradu. litce, merli, centi, decti, dekto, femti, gigdo, gocti, gotro, kilto, megdo, mikri, milti, nanvi, petso, picti, terto, xatsi, xexso, zepti, zetro)

d:entry.p: Note: emphasis on route nature; solid door (= vrogai/vrobi'u/vrozu'itci). See also canko, ganlo, kalri, murta, pagre, bitmu, kuspe.

pagbu modal, 2nd place (whole) partially.
as a part of ...

defaults as time tense.

approximating/next to ...

d:entry.p: (x1 may be object or si'o idea); See also cmavo list ma'i, ckilu, merli, pajni, cimde, jdice, marde.

ul.li: x1 is a current/flow/river of/in x2 flowing in direction to/towards x3 from direction/source x4.

d:entry.p: [x1 is a stream of x2; x2 is a fluid Gas or liquid. (= selfle for reordered places); x1 flushes toward x3; flush (= caifle, sukfle)]; See also rirxe, senta where no directionality is implied, rinci, xampo, dikca, sakci, gapci, litki, ciblu.

ul.li: Lithuania.
digit/number: fraction slash.
default "/n" => 1/n, "n/" => n/1, or "/" alone => golden ratio.
evidential: although, even though, while, whilst.
m1 is a windmill performing process m2.
x1 is broomrape of species x2.
x1 rhymes/alliterates with x2 in language/phonetics x3, matching sound correspondence x4 (ka).

d:entry.p: Broad meaning of rhyme - any matching sound correspondence. See also pemci, sanga.

sumti question asking for a quantity.
how many?.

Beijing.

Latin 'aut'.

vocative: promise - promise release - un-promise.
convert number to cardinality selbri.
x1 is the mass formed from set x2 whose n member(s) are x3.

d:entry.p: [x1 is a mass with N components x3 composing set x2; x2 is an n-tuple (x2 is completely specified) (= selmei for reordered places); x1 forms an n-some; x3 (not necessarily a complete enumeration) are among the members of x2]; See also cmima, gunma, cmavo list moi.

ul.li: attitudinal: caution - rashness.

d:entry.p: See also capyrivbi, capfanta, srerivbi, srefanta, naldarsi, seljde.

ul.li: x1 is harmonious/concordant/in agreement/concord with x2 in property x3 (ka).

d:entry.p: See also satci, panpi, mapti, tugni, ckini.

ul.li: vocative: hospitality - inhospitality.
opposite of za'o: event contour: refers to the portion of the event which occurs before the natural beginning.
starting too early before ...
x1 is an era/epoch/age characterized by x2 (event/property/interval/idea).

d:entry.p: (x2 interval should be the defining boundaries; if merely a characterizing period, the nature of the interval should be expressed in an abstract bridi, or the interval should be marked with tu'a; x2 may also be characteristic object(s) or practices of the era, if marked with tu'a); See also ranji, temci, citsi.

ul.li: digit/number: 1 (digit) [one].
b1 is the first Buddha, Siddhartha Gautama.

d:entry.p: Cf. budjo, pa, moi, lijda, censa

start questionable/out-of-context quote.
text should be Lojban words, but needn't be grammatical.

m1 is a forwarder/remailer.

a scale or set is implied.

m1n1 is m2n2 nanometer(s) / billionth(s) of a meter [metric unit] in length (default 1) measured in direction m3n3 by standard x4m3.

d:entry.p: See also centre. Made from nanvi + mitre.

d:entry.p: The proposal also includes an experimental Loglan Little word ``hoa'' (which toggles text to Lojban).

d:entry.p: Cook with heat (= glajukpa, glaterjukpa), bake (= tokyjukpa); fry (= rasyjukpa). See also cupra, bredi.

surrounding/annular ...

x1 is titanium (metal).
x1 (object) fills/becomes stuffed [up]/inflates/blows up with material x2.
x2 pours into x1.

d:entry.p: Implies some relative degree of fullness will result; agentive filling (= tisyse'a, tisygau, tisyzu'e); inflate/become inflated/blow up (= gacytisna, agentive gacyse'a); pour into (= liktisna, agentive likse'a). See also culno, kunti, rinci, setca.

ul.li: b1 expels c1 from c2.
b1 throws c1 out of c2.
x1 is an expert/pro/has prowess in/is skilled at x2 (event/activity) by standard x3.

d:entry.p: Also competent, skilled. See also djuno, stati, kakne.

ul.li: compound abstractor: sentence/equation abstract.
x1 is text expressing [bridi] which is x2.
r1 is the head-of-government of polity t2.

d:entry.p: from turni ralju c.f. nolraitru vliraitru viptru gugja'a trupauja'a.

ul.li: attitudinal: courage - timidity - cowardice.
subscript.
attaches a numer of letteral string following as a subscript onto grammar structures.
x1 doctors/treats/nurses/[cures]/is physician/midwife to x2 for ailment x3 by treatment/cure x4.

d:entry.p: Also medic; (adjective:) x1, x4 is medical; x2 is a patient of x1 (= selmikce for reordered places) ; x2 is treated by x1 person/x4 treatment/method; successfully cure transitive (= sadmikce, sadvelmikce), intransitive (= sadyselmikce, ka'orbi'o to not imply an external agent/process, though the x1 and x4 of mikce may be self/internal); treatment (= velmikce). See also bilma, kanro, spita.

ul.li: x1 is a satellite/moon orbiting x2 with characteristics x3, orbital parameters x4.

dimensionality of space interval tense: 4-space interval.
throughout a spacetime.
g1 (force) is g2 Newton (SI unit) by standard g3.
x1 (person) decides/makes decision x2 (du'u) about matter x3 (event/state).

d:entry.p: See also pajni, cuxna, kanji, manri.

[automated apparatus, without direct function control].

d:entry.p: Also machinery/mechanism; a machine is initiated/triggered by an agent/force, but thereafter performs its function automatically; if self-directed, (a minji is an) entity (= zukte). See also cabra, matra, tutci, zukte, pilno, skami.

ul.li: x1 is mortal/subject to death.

pleasing ...
in order to please ...

attitudinal: appreciation - envy.
t1 is the pattern/shape of word v1t2 with meaning v2 in language v3.
x1 is a teardrop wept by x2 for reason x3.
s1 (mass of facts) is the science of thermodymanics / science of / about heat / heating based on methodology s3.

d:entry.p: Made from glare and saske. saske2 and all places of glare subsumed.

ul.li: krasi modal, 1st place from source/origin/starting point ...
x1 is polite/courteous/civil in matter x2 according to standard/custom x3.

d:entry.p: Also formal, ritual. See also ritli.

ul.li: x1 is a quantity of hemp/marijuana/jute of species/strain x2.

d:entry.p: See also skori, tanko, sigja, xukmi.

ul.li: x1 is a lion/[lioness] of species/breed x2.
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #9 (specified by goi).
x1 is a market/store/exchange/shop(s) selling/trading (for) x2, operated by/with participants x3.

d:entry.p: Also: mall, marketplace, shopping center, cooperative, bazaar, trading post, mart; the concept is the function of selling/exchanging coupled with a location, and is more oriented to the larger concept of marketplace than the stalls/shops that comprise it, though it does not exclude the latter individual shops (= zaisle); x3 may include both owners/proprietors and customers in some markets, but in most contexts refers only to the operators. See also vecnu, canja, dinju, banxa.

ul.li: x1 wears/is robed/garbed in x2 as a garment of type x3.

d:entry.p: x2 need not be intended for use as a garment (unlike taxfu). See also taxfu.

ul.li: x1 is August of year x2 in calendar x3.
x1 (agent) fastens/connects/attaches/binds/lashes x2 to x3 with fastener x4.

d:entry.p: No implication that result is considered a single object; although x2 and x3 may be reversible, x3 may be used for the substrate, the fixed/larger object to which x2 becomes attached. See also jorne, fenso, jgena, batke, dinko, kansa.

ul.li: x1 is a blackberry/raspberry/bramble of species x2.
x1 is the morphology of x2 according to methodology x3.
j1 is an adress of / are co-ordinates of computer system / computerized thing j2s1 in system j3.
computerized thing has purpose s2.

d:entry.p: Normally, s2 might be dropped, but it's very useful to be able to point out if this is a samymri address or a ueb address. Made from skami + judri.

ul.li: catni modal, 3rd place authoritatively.
with basis of authority ...
x1 [agent] ceases/stops/halts/ends activity/process/state x2 [not necessarily completing it].

d:entry.p: See also fanmo, mulno, cfari, denpa, fliba.

ul.li: x1 is made of/contains/is a quantity of milk from source x2.
(adjective:) x1 is lactic/dairy.

d:entry.p: See also lanbi, mabru, tatru, cirla, kruji.

ul.li: x1 opposes/balances/contends against opponent(s) x2 (person/force ind./mass) about x3 (abstract).

d:entry.p: Also resists. See also bandu, bradi, darlu, damba, jivna, lanxe, rivbi, sarji, xarnu.

ul.li: ASCII.
x1 has control over/harnesses/manages/directs/conducts x2 in x3 (activity/event/performance).

d:entry.p: x2 are aspects/individuals controlled within activity/event x3; manage (= selzuktro, selzukfu'e, gu'etro, gunfu'e, xaktro, xakfu'e) (as distinct from manager/boss = gunterbe'e, gunja'a, gunmi'e, gunca'i). (cf. cmavo list ji'o, bapli, te bende, gidva - which does not necessarily control or command, jatna, macnu, minde, ponse, ralju, rinka, sazri, turni, vlipa, xance, xlura)

ul.li: elidable terminator: end NOI relative clause.
always elidable, but preferred in complex clauses.
x1 reflects Hebrew/Jewish/Israeli culture/nationality/language in aspect x2.
k4m1 graduates/completes coursework from k1 at location k2 in subject matter k3, by the standards of the administration k5m3.

d:entry.p: This is really a dropped SE of velkulmu'o. m2 is the implied "property of learning at k2 subject matter k3 from school k1"

ul.li: x1 (quoted word(s)) is a/the name/title/tag of x2 to/used-by namer/name-user x3 (person).

d:entry.p: Also: x2 is called x1 by x3 (= selcme for reordered places). See also cmavo list me'e, gismu, tcita, valsi, judri.

ul.li: x1 is a garden/tended/cultivated field of family/community/farmer x2 growing plants/crop x3.

d:entry.p: Orchard (= ricpurdi). See also foldi, cange, panka.

ul.li: x1 is magic/supernatural/sorcery/witchcraft/wizardry to x2, performed by person/force/deity x3.
s1 is the/a umbilical cord connecting t1x2 to mother t2x3.
x1 offers/proffers x2 [offering] to x3 with conditions x4.

d:entry.p: (x4 may be nu canja, nu pleji, etc.; an unconditional offering has the 'condition' of acceptance); x2 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= posfriti, posyselfriti for unambiguous semantics). See also canja, dunda, rinsa, vecnu, jdima, cnemu, pleji, vitke.

ul.li: \emph1. to the degree of...When prefixed by a number, turns the number into a selbri that expresses some truth value between zero and one, inclusive. \emph2. it may or may not be the case that ...

d:entry.p: This experimental cmavo form has been assigned meanings several times independently. The first sense, suggested on the Lojban Wiki by Xod, generalizes na and ja'a by creating a scale between them. This can be seen as an implementation of fuzzy logic. This sense has now been retired in favor of subscripting ja'a with xi. The other sense, apparently invented by Nora Lechevalier some time earlier (at least before 1997), is not intended seriously, but rather as a kind of reductio-ad-absurdum. As it makes any sentence true, regardless of the content, it shows that a language that is excessively free to interpretation is impossible to express anything in.

d:entry.p: organic applies to chemicals; carbon-based to life forms. The distinction between tabyselcmu and mivyselkra is that e.g. calcium phosphate in bones is mivyselkra but not tabyselcmu, while polyethylene is tabyselcmu but not mivyselkra.

See also damri, dansu, flani, janbe, jgita, pipno, rilti, tabra, tonga, xagri, siclu.

See also catlu, jvinu, kanla, minra, simlu, djuno, jimpe, zgana, ganse.

replace recent mistakenly uttered text.

d:entry.p: The lo'ai ... sa'ai ... le'ai replacement construct asks the listener to replace the text after lo'ai with the text after sa'ai. The order sa'ai ... lo'ai ... le'ai is also allowed, and either or both parts can be omitted and thus left up to context. When both parts are omitted, the word le'ai on its own indicates that a mistake was made while leaving all the details up to context.

(but note that Lojban does not require specificity, just as English doesn't for either milk or eggs; "sovda" is fine for most contexts); If fertilized, then tsiju or tarbi. d:entry.p: A tile is a 3-dimensional object, relatively uniform and significant in the 3rd dimension, but thin enough that its shape in the the other two dimensions is a significant feature; 'city block' is conceptually a tile; polygon (= taplytai or kardytai - shaped like an approximately-2-dimensional block, lijyclupa - a loop composed of lines). (cf. bliku, kubli, matci; karda, for which the 3rd dimension is insignificant, bliku, kurfa, matci, plita, tarmi)

ul.li: x1 (event) annoys/irritates/bothers/distracts x2.

d:entry.p: Also: is disruptive to. See also fengu, raktu, dicra, tunta, zunti, jicla.

ul.li: mukti modal, 2nd place motive nevertheless ...
x1 is a compass with magnet x2.
x1 is a caravan consisting of x2 traveling across/through x3.
k1 is a bookshelf attached to k2.
s1k3g1 is a paliamentary republic with representatives s2k1 representating community g2k2 (mass) .
x1d1c1 wants to say/express x2c2 (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) for audience x3c3 via expressive medium x4c4, and this is desired for purpose x5d3.

d:entry.p: Generally used to correct another's perceived mistake, i.e. "mi klami" followed by ".i pe'i du djisku zo klama". See also djica, cusku.

ul.li: x1 is a ring/annulus/torus/circle [shape/form] of material x2, inside diam. x3, outside diam. x4.

d:entry.p: Also ellipse, oval (= jincla); (usage has been for near-circles, such as tight spirals, even if not closed loops). Also band, belt, encircle (= jinsru). See also clupa, cukla, dasri, karli, sovda, sruri, konju.

ul.li: x1 is dress/a garment/clothing for wearing by x2 (gender/species/body part) serving purpose x3.

d:entry.p: Also: x2 can wear/is wearing x1; refers to something intended for use as a garment, not merely something that happens to be worn at some time (which need not be true for dasni). See also creka, cutci, daski, dasni, gluta, kosta, mapku, palku, pastu, skaci, smoka, lunbe.

ul.li: possessive/associative descriptor: distant demonstrative possessive.
j1 micromanages j2 in activity/event performance j3t2.
x2b1 is on the outside of x1b2.
x2b1 is exterior to x1b2.
x1 is a colobus of species x2.
attitudinal: complaint - pleasure.
g1 [person/agent] confuses c1 (event/state) for c2 [observer] due to [confusing] property c3 (ka).
x1 (object/event) is at/attending/present at x2 (event/location).

d:entry.p: Atemporal; location equivalent of cabna. Refers to a nonce location for an object/activity that is mobile. (cf. especially stuzi for an inherent/inalienable location, jbini, nenri, se vasru, cpana, diklo, jibni, cabna, lamji, tcini, xabju, jmive, jundi, vitke)

ul.li: x1 is an octopus of species x2.
x1 (person) is serious/earnest/has gravity about x2 (event/state/activity).

d:entry.p: Also solemn (= drijunri, ri'irjunri, tcejunri). See also tilju, xalbo, badri, ritli.

ul.li: k1 is black magic to k2, performed by person/force/deity k3.
x1 is timid/shy/abashed/reluctant to do /be x2.
panra modal, 4nd place (standard/geometry) similarly.
similar by standard ...
x1 is a gazelle of species x2.
j1b1 is the Chinese-Mandarin language, used by b2 to communicate b3 (si'o/du'u, not quote).
x1 slides/slips/glides on x2.

d:entry.p: x2 is slick/slippery to/for x1 (= selsakli for reordered places). See also mosra, fulta, skiji, xutla.

ul.li: x1 is a letter/missive/[note] to intended audience x2 from author/originator x3 with content x4.

d:entry.p: (cf. notci, which has places in a different order; the emphasis in xatra is on the communication between author and recipient, and not the content, which in a letter may not easily be categorized to a 'subject'; ciska, mrilu, papri)

ul.li: s1 is geography based on methodology s3.
x1 is a crucifix.
c1a1 is a geek/nerd of field c2a2 (event/activity) by standard c3.
x1 is a lens/glass [focussing shape/form] focussing x2 to focus/foci x3 by means/material x4.

d:entry.p: (adjective:) x1 is optical; focussing may be optical or otherwise, hence x2 which may be light, sound, X-ray, etc., default is light/optical lens; ka is refraction. See also kacma, minra.

ul.li: x1 is a quantity of buckwheat/rhubarb/sorrel grass of species/strain x2.
x1 is an exception/the only one without property x2 among x3.
number/quantity: 40 [forty].
x2b1 reflects British/United Kingdom culture/nationality in aspect x1b2.
x1 is Friday of week x2 on calendar x3.
x1 is an exit/outlet/way out of x2 for x3.
x3b1 is a bundle/package/cluster/clump/pack [shape/form] containing x2b2, held together by x1b3.
attitudinal: agreement - disagreement.
x1 (text) is a compound predicate word with meaning x2 and arguments x3 built from metaphor x4.

d:entry.p: See also stura, cmavo, gismu, rafsi, smuni.

ul.li: attitudinal: completion - incompleteness.

d:entry.p: See also mulno, mansa, fanmo, snada.

ul.li: g1m1 is a complete set showing common property (ka) g2, complete by standard m3.
interval event contour: at the ending point of ... even if not done.
cessative | >< |.
x1 is a print/impression/image on/in surface x2 of/made by/using tool/press/implement/object x3.

d:entry.p: See also cukta, papri, pelji, pixra, ciska, danre, barna.

ul.li: x1 is an airplane/aircraft [flying vehicle] for carrying passengers/cargo x2, propelled by x3.
x1 is a hotel/inn/hostel at location x2 operated by x3.
p1 is a test-paper from source p2 for/proof of property/state c3 in subject c4.
x1 is invisible from point-of-view x2.

d:entry.p: gismu ( rafsi: bloti, lot, blo, lo'i )

ul.li: x1 is a boat/ship/vessel [vehicle] for carrying x2, propelled by x3.

d:entry.p: See also falnu, fulta, marce, jatna, sabnu.

ul.li: x1 is a quantity of/contains bread [leavened or unleavened] made from grains x2.
v4m1c1 is a compact disc/optical disc storing v2 (data/facts/du'u) about v3 (object/event) in file(s) v1.
x1 is a million [106] of x2 in dimension/aspect x3 (default is units).

d:entry.p: (cf. grake, mitre, snidu, stero, delno, molro, kelvo, xampo, gradu. litce, merli, centi, decti, dekto, femti, gigdo, gocti, gotro, kilto, mikri, milti, nanvi, petso, picti, terto, xatsi, xecto, xexso, zepti, zetro)

ul.li: x1 is the front of air mass x2.

d:entry.p: see also lenku, glare, stali, selzu'i

ul.li: f1=c1 is a volcano projecting from land mass c2.
x1 erroneously defends x2 against x3.
x2 is allergic to x3.
x1 is the daytime of day x2 at location x3.
(adjective:) x1 is diurnal (vs. nocturnal).
x1 fishes for fish species x2.
evidential: I know by internal experience (dream, vision, or personal revelation).
fasnu modal, 1st place (non-causal) in the event of ...
c1a1 is tall / has a long body by standard c3.
x1 spreads/expands over/into x2 from initial state x3.

d:entry.p: See also tcena, kuspe, ranji, fatri, muvdu, benji.

ul.li: x1 travels/journeys/goes/moves via route x2 using means/vehicle x3.
x1 is a traveller.

d:entry.p: (x2 as a set includes points at least sufficient to constrain the route relevantly); See also bajra, cadzu, cpare, tcana, klama, cliva, pluta, limna, muvdu.

ul.li: k1m1 is US culture.
x1 is June of year x2 in calendar x3.
x1 is a chili/bell pepper (Capsicum) of species/variety x2.

d:entry.p: cf. cpina, spatrpiperi, tamca, patlu, tanko, mlongena

ul.li: x1 [donor] gives/donates gift/present x2 to recipient/beneficiary x3 [without payment/exchange].

d:entry.p: Also grants; x3 is a receiver (= terdu'a for reordered places); the Lojban doesn't distinguish between or imply possession transfer or sharing; x2 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= posydu'a, posyseldu'a for unambiguous semantics). See also benji, muvdu, canja, pleji, vecnu, friti, sfasa, dapma, cnemu, prali.

ul.li: x1 is a snake/serpent of species/breed x2.

d:entry.p: See also curnu, danlu, respa, vindu.

ul.li: x1 is writing / a written thing / written text written by x2 on x3 with writing implement x4.

d:entry.p: Made from se + ciska. See also seltcidu, lerseltcidu.

ul.li: s1 commits faux pas (social error) s2, which is wrong under conditions s3 according to standard s4.
x1 (action) is easy/simple/facile for x2 (agent) under conditions x3.
x2 does x1 freely/easily.
x1 is a pear [fruit] of species/strain x2.
x1 is a rite/ceremony/ritual for purpose/goal x2, by custom/in community x3, with form/rules x4.

d:entry.p: [also: x1 is formal, Legal. x1 is 'going through the motions']; x4 constraints/customs; See also lijda, malsi, flalu, javni, tcaci, clite, junri.

ul.li: a1p1 is a character/role/imaginary person created by a2.
x1 reflects Lebanese culture/nationality in aspect x2.
x1 is the country of peoples x2 with land/territory x3.
(people/territory relationship).

d:entry.p: Also sovereignty, domestic (as opposed to foreign), nation (when not referring to ethos). See also turni, natmi, jecta, tumla, tutra, lanci.

ul.li: x1 runs on surface x2 using limbs x3 with gait x4.

d:entry.p: See also cadzu, klama, litru, stapa, plipe, cpare.

ul.li: l1 steals l2 from l3, which is a crime according to z2.
c1 is capitalism as practiced by p1s2.

d:entry.p: From sivni, ponse, ciste. Cf. guntrusi'o, fairpaltrusi'o.

ul.li: x1 is virtuous/saintly/[fine/moral/nice/holy/morally good] by standard x2.

d:entry.p: Holy/saintly (= cesyvu'e). Virtue the attribute is "ka vrude". See also palci, xamgu, marde, zabna.

ul.li: x1 is a nargileh/hookah for smoking x2.
logically quantified universal sumti: everything (unless restricted).
discursive: simply - elaborating.
x1 is holy/sacred to person/people/culture/religion/cult/group x2.

d:entry.p: See also cevni, krici, latna, pruxi, lijda, sinma.

ul.li: f1s2 is the dessert of meal f2s1.
left mathematical bracket.
x1 is Georgian (Caucasus) in aspect x2.
x1n1 is a memorandum stating facts x2m2 about x3m3n2 from author x4n3 to intended audience x5n4m1 who should remember x2 about x3.
x1 is the locus where x2 is bitten/pinched by x3 with x4.
self vocative: self-introduction - denial of identity.
identifies speaker.
x1 is a round number in base x2.

d:entry.p: x2 may be 1, in which case x1 is round in the absolute sense, such as 278628139008. See also saclu.

ul.li: x1 is 10-21 of x2 in dimension/aspect x3 (default is units).

d:entry.p: (cf. grake, mitre, snidu, stero, delno, molro, kelvo, xampo, gradu. litce, merli, centi, decti, dekto, femti, gigdo, gocti, gotro, kilto, megdo, mikri, milti, nanvi, petso, picti, terto, xatsi, xecto, xexso, zetro)

ul.li: x1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of tar/asphalt from source x2.
x1 is a sea/ocean/gulf/[atmosphere] of planet x2, of fluid x3.
(adjective:) x1 is marine.

d:entry.p: Also atmosphere (= varxamsi, varsenta). See also daplu, djacu, lalxu, rirxe, tumla, vacri, zbani, ctaru.

ul.li: s1 is a nationalist political ideology as applied by t1p1 among/in people/territory/domain t2 based on the works of thinker s3.

d:entry.p: From natmi, prami, turni, sidbo. Cf. natpa'i, trudjigri, ka'irtrusi'o, dzejdasratrusi'o, vricykricrutrusi'o, fairpaltrusi'o, guntrusi'o, tsarainaitrusi'o.

ul.li: x1 is a generation of x2.
x1 is Korea.
x2b1 is cloth/fabric of type/material x1b2.
x2b1 reflects Malay-Indonesian common language/culture in aspect x1b2.
emotion category/modifier: mental - mindless.
x1 is a fate/destiny of x2.
[doom, curse are mabla-forms].
x2 is fated/predestined/doomed to x1.
k1 is an operating theatre in which to perform surgery m4.
x1 (property - ka) is a flaw/fault/defect in x2 causing x3.

d:entry.p: See also cikre, srera, fenra, fliba, prane.

ul.li: non-veridical descriptor: the set of those described as ..., treated as a set.
discursive: making a tanru - expanding the tanru.
x1 [seller] sells/vends x2 [goods/service/commodity] to buyer x3 for amount/cost/expense x4.

d:entry.p: x1 is a salesperson/salesman/vendor; x3 buys x2 from x1 (= terve'u for reordered terms); x4 is the price of x2 to x3 (= velve'u for reordered terms); for sale (= fitselve'u, selvenfriti); x2 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= posyve'u, posyselve'u for unambiguous semantics). (cf. canja, dunda, janta, pleji, jerna, kargu, prali, zarci, vamji, jdima; see note at jdima on cost/price/value distinction, fepni, friti, jerna, rupnu)

ul.li: x1 has truth-value x2 under metaphysics x3 on scale x4.
x1 is idle/at rest/inactive.

d:entry.p: "in motion", not implying a change in location, is negation of this. See also surla.

ul.li: x1 loves/feels strong affectionate devotion towards x2 (object/state).

d:entry.p: Also: x1 is loving towards x2, x1 is a lover of x2 (one sense), x2 is beloved by x1 (= selpa'i for reordered places). See also cinmo, xebni, nelci, djica, sinma, pluka, kurji, pendo, speni.

ul.li: x1 is a material object enduring in space-time.
x1 is a thing.
s1 is the concept of representative democracy (default: political representative democracy) as it applies to the governance of t2 based on the works of thinker(s) s3.

d:entry.p: From krati, turni, sidbo. Cf. dzejdasratrusi'o, vricykricrutrusi'o, fairpaltrusi'o, guntrusi'o, natpamtrusi'o, tsarainaitrusi'o.

ul.li: x1 is a cabin of vehicle x2.

d:entry.p: See also bloti, marce, vinji, karce.

ul.li: x1v1t1 is most important/most significant to x2v2 in aspect/for reason x3v3 among set/range x4t4.
k1 is a beach/coast of sea a1k2 on landmass k3.
x1 is paste/pulp/dough/mash/mud/slurry [soft, smooth-textured, moist solid] of composition x2.

d:entry.p: x2: composition including x2, which need not be complete specification. See also marxa, kliti, tarla.

ul.li: s1d1 is Celtic in aspect s2.
sumti place tag: tag 1st sumti place.
g1 parks/moors/berths/anchors vehicle s1 at s2.
x1 is fond of/likes/has a taste for x2 (object/state).

d:entry.p: See also cinmo, djica, pluka, prami, rigni, sinma, trina, xebni, cuxna, pendo.

ul.li: attitudinal contour: start emotion - continue emotion - end emotion.
Peking.
x1 is a jet [expelled stream] of material x2 expelled from x3.
x1 is a fruit [body-part] of species x2.

d:entry.p: See also badna, dembi, figre, guzme, narge, perli, pilka, plise, spati, stagi, tamca, tsiju, tarbi, panzi, rorci, te pruce, jbari, nimre.

ul.li: x1 is a sassaby/topi/korrigum/damalisk of species/breed x2.
b1g1 has a fever due to disease b3.
attitudinal: approval - non-approval - disapproval.
srana modal, 2nd place (pertaining to) relevantly.
concerning ... (less specific).
x1 is a quantity quantified/measured/enumerated by x2 (quantifier) on scale x3 (si'o).

d:entry.p: Also count. See also cmavo list la'u, namcu.

ul.li: n-ary mathematical operator: times.
multiplication operator.
x1 engenders/procreates/begets x2 with coparent x3.

d:entry.p: See also grute, gutra, rirni, se panzi, mamta, patfu, tarbi, bersa, ferti, jbena, sovda.

ul.li: t1f1 is a raft of material t2 shape t3 floating on f2.
x2b1 is great/grand in property x1b2 (ka) by standard x3b3.
x1 is green/verdant [color adjective].

d:entry.p: See also skari, blabi, xekri, kandi, carmi, cicna.

ul.li: x1 is beautiful/pleasant to x2 in aspect x3 (ka) by aesthetic standard x4.

d:entry.p: Also handsome, pretty, gorgeous, cute, comely, graceful. See also pluka, xamgu.

ul.li: x1 is a rosary with beads of material x2 with link properties x3.
x1 ridicules/mocks/scoffs at x2 about x3 (property/event) by doing activity x4 (event).
tense interval modifier: atypically.
subjective tense/modal.
defaults as time tense.
j1 is an altar for offering f2 to f3.
x1 is a shuttle between x2 and x3, traveling along route x4, carrying passengers x5.
x1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of alkali metal of type x2 [default sodium].

d:entry.p: Also potassium, lithium, cesium. Soda. See also jilka, jinme.

ul.li: logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought and.
x1 is a reed of/for wind instrument x2.
c1a1 is a Pokémon/Pocket Monster of species a2.
s1 is symmetrical about axis m1.
x1 is a guest/visitor of x2 at place/event x3.
x1 visits x2/x3.

d:entry.p: See also friti, klama, zasni, xabju, zvati.

ul.li: attitudinal: attentive - inattentive - avoiding.
x1 is October/tenth month of year x2 in calendar x3.

d:entry.p: Note: Based on experimental rafsi for dau (duv). Use with caution. Alternative: pavnonma'i

ul.li: p1g1 is Japan.
n1 is a cake/cookie made from grains n2.
x1 (obj.) is loose/bloused/not tight on x2 (obj.) at locus x3.
x1 is a/the lip [body-part]/rim of orifice x2 of body x3.
(adjective:) x1 is labial.
x1 blade/scraper/erosive scrapes/erodes/abrades x2 from x3.

d:entry.p: Abrade, abrasive (= mosyguska). See also balre, sraku, batci, canpa, mosra.

ul.li: event contour for a temporary halt and ensuing pause in a process.
number/quantity: 400 [four hundred].
x1 is a quantity of cabbage/lettuce/leafy vegetable of species/strain x2.
x1 is full/completely filled with x2.

d:entry.p: See also tisna, kunti, mulno, setca, tisna.

ul.li: x1 is a cephalopod of species x2.
pro-sumti: repeats 3rd place of main bridi of this sentence.
x1 is a quantity of rye [grain] of species/strain x2.
x1 (idea abstract) is an idea/concept/thought about x2 (object/abstract) by thinker x3.

d:entry.p: Also (adjective:) x1 is ideal/ideational. See also ciksi, jijnu, mucti, jinvi, nabmi, pensi, xanri, cmavo list si'o.

ul.li: i1 is a lung with lunged-fish e2i1.

d:entry.p: See also fipybirka, fipyrebla for other fish-body related words.

ul.li: abstractor: quantity/amount abstractor.
x1 is quantity/amount of [bridi] measured on scale x2.
x1 reflects Greek/Hellenic culture/nationality/language in aspect x2.
x1 is prose about plot/theme/subject x2 by author x3 for intended audience x4.

d:entry.p: Non-poetic written text, without intentional rhyme or meter; x2 may be a convention rather than a subject. See also cfika, lisri, cukta, pemci, finti.

ul.li: a1 is a hemisphere of sphere b1a2, of material b2, halfness standard a3.
x1 is a comb [many-needled shape] of material x2 with tines/needles x3.
x1 is autumn/fall [harvest/cooling season] of year x2 at location x3.

d:entry.p: See also citsi, crisa, dunra, vensa, crepu.

ul.li: x1 is a bundle/package/cluster/clump/pack [shape/form] containing x2, held together by x3.
attitudinal: feeling constraint - independence - challenge/resistance against constraint.
m1c1 is m2c2 centimeter(s) / hundredth(s) of a meter [metric unit] in length (default 1) measured in direction m3c3 by standard x4m3.

d:entry.p: See also navytre. Made from centi + mitre.

ul.li: x1 (person) explains x2 (event/state/property) to x3 with explanation x4 (du'u).

d:entry.p: Explanation x4 is an underlying mechanism/details/purpose/method for x2 (= velcki for reordered places), generally assumed to be non-obvious; metaphorical usage with the various causal relations (i.e. jalge, mukti, krinu, rinka, nibli, zukte) is possible, but the non-obviousness, and the existence of an explainer with a point of view makes this word not a simple expression of cause. See also cipra, danfu, jalge, jinvi, krinu, mukti, nabmi, preti, rinka, sidbo, zukte, tavla.

ul.li: x1 is a/the ear [body-part] of x2.
[metaphor: sensory apparatus, information gathering].

d:entry.p: (adjective:) x1 is aural. See also kanla, savru, smaji, tirna, ractu.

ul.li: quantified selbri: convert .5 to probability selbri.
event x1 has a 50/50 chance under cond. x2.
x1 (person) feels/has pride in/about x2 (abstraction).

d:entry.p: An emotional combination of satisfaction and respect/esteem towards property(ies) or action(s) of person/entity that has a specific tie to emoter; self-pride (= se'ijgi, tolcumla); use x2 tu'a for pride in non-specific actions/properties of someone. See also cinmo, cumla, sevzi, sinma, snada.

ul.li: x1 is a myth/legend, a culturally significant story about x2 in mythos x3 of culture x4.

d:entry.p: Also: x1 is mythical/fairy tale; used adjectivally for non-humanoid creatures (= ramda'u) of story/myth/legend/religion, e.g. dragon; fairy tale (= veryranmi). See also lijda, lisri, crida.

ul.li: logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought x but not y.
s1g1 is Australia.
attitudinal: attentive - inattentive - avoiding.
Nameless.
x1 is a Sunday of week x2 in calendar x3.

d:entry.p: Sunday is either day seven or day zero, depending on your perspective.

ul.li: tense interval modifier: characteristically/typically.
tense/modal.
defaults as time tense.
x1 is a spider/arachnid/[crustacean/crab/lobster/non-insect arthropod] of species/breed x2.
x1 is a Saturday of week x2 in calendar x3.
tense interval modifier: once.
objectively quantified tense.
defaults as time tense.
c1t1 is the government of organizational type c2 of people/territory/domain/subjects t2 displaying properties c4.

d:entry.p: From turni, ciste. Cf. zuktruci'e, flatruci'e, pairtruci'e, flacfatrugri, flazautrugri, trupau, trupausle.

ul.li: p1 is a silhouette of f1 made by p3 in medium p4.
Singapore.
x1 differs/is distinct from/contrasts with/is unlike x2 in property/dimension/quantity x3.

d:entry.p: Also other-than (less common meaning). See also ranxi, drata, dunli, simsa, vrici.

ul.li: k1 believes [without evidence/proof] that the god/deity c1 exists.
x1 is apart/separate from x2, separated by partition/wall/gap/interval/separating medium x3.

d:entry.p: Also aloof (= jiksei); alone (= rolsmisei meaning apart or unlike all others of its kind; pavysei, seirpavmei meaning "only" or "one alone" - do not use when talking about, for example, two people who are alone); x3 space. See also bitmu, snuji, senta, fendi, curve, jinsa, bitmu, marbi.

ul.li: x1 makes/assembles/builds/manufactures/creates x2 out of materials/parts/components x3.

d:entry.p: Should not be used to express causation. See also cupra, larcu, rutni, finti, gundi.

ul.li: pro-sumti: remote future utterance.
"He'll tell you tomorrow. IT will be a doozy.".
x1 (agent) harvests/reaps/gathers crop/product/objects x2 from source/area x3.
left parenthesis.
start of parenthetical note which must be grammatical Lojban text.
x1 is a knot/tangle in/between x2 (object/jo'u-objects).

d:entry.p: Knot (verb = jgegau, jgezu'e, jgeri'a, jgela'a), knot: fastening between two or more cords (= jgeterjo'e). See also pluja, julne, lasna, skori.

ul.li: b1m1 is huge/enormous/very big in property b2 with criterion b3.

d:entry.p: mutce+barda; see also: brabra, caibra, selte'abra, dukse, cimni, camganra; antonym: cmacma

ul.li: attitudinal contour: start emotion - continue emotion - end emotion.

d:entry.p: Also subspecies, order, phylum; (places do not correspond to specific levels in the hierarchy; rather, x1 is at a "lower" or "bushier" part of the tree than x2, x2 is "lower" than x3, etc.; skipping a place thus means that there is one or more known-and-unspecified levels of hierarchy between the two); not limited to Linnean animal/plant taxonomy. See also klesi, lanzu.

d:entry.p: Thumb (specifically the hand = xantamji), big toe (= jmatamji). See also degji, tance, xance, jamfu.

ul.li: x1 (object) moves to destination/receiver x2 [away] from origin x3 over path/route x4.

d:entry.p: Also mobile (= comymu'u, for the non-specific opposite of immobile); after a muvdu, object is alienated from/no longer at origin (unless physically returned there, per litru or slilu); agentive move (= muvgau, muvzu'e), non-agentive transitive move (= muvri'a), self-propelled (= sezmuvgau), motion of a part of the object (= pagmu'u), having a moving part (= muvypau, muvyselpau); apparent motion (= mlumu'u). (cf. rinci, klama (which differs in that the means of motion is explicit), litru, cliva, fatri; dunda, benji for agentive movement that does not necessarily imply alienation from origin, preja for similar movement with no agent implied, bevri, vimcu)

ul.li: attitudinal: physical complaint.

d:entry.p: Use x1 tu'a for non-specific interest in an object; interested in (= selci'i). See also zdile, kucli, manci, kurji.
